author: Balloon Head

text: You can't even begin to imagine. This game blew my mind away in 2005 and continues to hold up as the greatest and most elaborate mindfuck I've ever experienced. There are not enough words in this box to describe. The story masterfully weaves real and surreal elements together with uncanny, badass style and then flips the whole thing over at the end. Then you replay it, knowing the "truth" and you can't believe how naive you were, or how anyone could write such a deeply complex story. Godly.
author: Eddie Richard

text: Out of curiosity, how "deep" is this game's storyline compared to, say, Metal Gear Solid?
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: This games story is so deep they had to write a short book on it called Hand in Killer 7 to explain more of it. Its crazy as hell

author: multicooldude131

text: Well, that's the cool thing about Suda51's games; You really can't confirm anything and you're allowed to interpret it your own way.  As much as I love this game, it's really weird and it kind of makes you question everything.  Heaven Smiles exist, and all of this strange stuff happens, so how is it not possible that there really were alternate personalities all along?

text: @SupraDarky I was a bit disappointed, it's mechanics weren't as solid as I would expect them to be coming from Mikami, the universe was kinda dull (for Suda51 standards, if it was by anyone else it would be considered very creative) and my biggest letdown was the soundtrack, an extremely underwhelming and unfitting score from Yamaoka, who basically just made a mediocre Silent Hill score when it doesn't even suit the game. Rental first recommended.
author: ModifiedDuck

text: This soundtrack is interesting to me...some of the tracks are obvious throwaways and kind of on the "hokey" side, and on the other hand, you have pieces like "Dissociative..." and "Sweet Relief" that are not only the best on the ST, but some of the BEST vgm work I've ever heard. Love this track. Thanks for posting.

author: MrRetrogamingBard

text:
Killer7's one of my fucking favorite games ever made. 
Masafumi Takada and Jun Fukuda made a great soundtrack, the graphics are still pretty stylish and the voice acting/cutscenes are second to none. It's not even like a game, really. It's more like a comic book imo. This game actually makes me want to eventually go to film school.
You should upload the whole OST! :)
author: Reaper679

text: I really liked this game, very unique. Great characters and story. I'm generally a fan of Suda51's games, but Killer7 is still my favorite after all these years. I really want to try Shadows of the Damned though.
